other_tests.findings: An oval-shaped, pseudoencapsulated whitish lesion above the levator muscle and close to the superior oblique muscle; histopathology showed a liposarcoma with heterogeneous appearance (myxoid and pleomorphic components) of intermediate grade (G2).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Palpable nodule developed at medial canthus representing recurrence; subsequent anterior orbitotomy revealed a new lesion, which was again excised en bloc with no residual macroscopic disease. Additional recurrence led to further anterior orbitotomy confirming recurrence of myxoid liposarcoma.

other_tests.findings: Nodular, whitish lesion arising from the superior oblique muscle; histopathology confirmed a pleomorphic liposarcoma with marked cellular atypia and muscle infiltration.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Five years later, mild ipsilateral proptosis developed with imaging confirming recurrence. A subsequent anterior orbitotomy was performed with residual macroscopic disease confirmed as low-grade (G1) liposarcoma.

other_tests.findings: Low-grade (G1) liposarcoma confirmed after three anterior orbitotomies over 15 years.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Recurrence led to further anterior orbitotomy where two distinct lesions were excised, followed by recurrence necessitating eyelid-sparing exenteration, with pathology confirming myxoid liposarcoma.

other_tests.findings: Biopsy revealed well-differentiated liposarcoma with mature adipocytes and multivacuolated lipoblasts.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No mention of changes over time.

other_tests.findings: Histopathology revealed myxoid liposarcoma with evidence of lipoblasts and characteristic scalloped edges lying in a mucinous matrix.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Subsequent escalating proptosis necessitating orbital radiotherapy, radical mastectomy, and chemotherapy before the development of extensive lung metastases.
No follow-up information provided for changes over time.
